text: <@U026103R3> sounds good, I'll get on those right away
Just a heads up, I committed some code that was cleaned up with the lint cleaner
<@U02F8TTPU>: kat is going to take on UI bugs so you can focus on low-level stuff
Thanks <@U026PHQ3J>, working on the crashlytics issues I know of right now (which should fix the moto x issue, although I haven't been able to reproduce it)
are you running with my stuff from last night?
cause that may have inadvertently fixed it
also <@U02F8TTPU> just assigned a crash on boot reported on the Asus Nexus 7 running 4.4.4 that would be great to take a look at next
ok, I know we have a nexus 7 in house so hopefully that will be easier to debug
I have all the latest code running, and I just made a fix that may have fixed it as well
cool cool, thanks
I think <@U026PHQ3J> fix should fix the Moto X issue, in crashlytics it looks like it hit OOM on the splash screen animation
ah gotcha
And I just fixed the other new one, a race condition in the sound callback
ok cool
i think then we should send out a new build soon
so that active theory can test out the destroy stuff
sounds good, going to check on this nexus 7 issue (didn't see a crashlytics for that one, so it might be another OOM)
ah ok thanks, yea let's try to get a handle on the nexus 7 crash before that builds goes out
yep, easily reproducible, it OOMs on the animation
can we do something similar to evans fix for the animation on samsung devices?
do we have proper resolution frames for the animation
or are they all xxx
I moved them to drawable-nodpi to try to help with scaling issues
which may have caused it
<@U026103R3> we need those to be recut
for the proper resolutions
its 78 frames that stay in memory for the duration of the animation
ok, question. we have a new GIF from the client so the animation is "bigger". if i give that to trent do you think he can extract the frames and cut them at the sizes needed?
or would someone else be able to extract those frames so he can cut them?
hand it to trent if he has capacity
I can extract the frames, it's a simple task in photoshop and I did it for the current resolutions
don't bother
yes to trent, i'll quickly let him know what we're asking for so he knows whats up when he gets it
ok cool
keeping the frames in xxxhdpi actually would have scaled them for lower dpi screens. by putting them in nodpi, they wonâ€™t get scaled for any phone screen
also, I have a motox if you guys need it
<@U0261PCRQ> yeah. still at 78 frames, i feel better with them being sized to the neighborhood that they should be in
especially since samsung likes to hold on to the memory
for sure. they could also be cropped significantly
I moved the frames back to drawable-xxxhdpi and it didn't crash the nexus 7 (although scaling looks pretty rough)
trent is on it. he'll be sending to <@U0261PCRQ> when done

1.7 is distributing on Fabric. Release notes:
Fix animation issues affecting Samsung, Nexus 7, Moto X, Note 4
Destroy WebGL on back
About UI improved
Removed Debug from nav drawer
I think the Moto X has a new issue... just saw a crash come through in android.view.GLES20Canvas.drawBitmap
Hopefully scaling image assets to proper resolutions can help with that, cause it looks pretty worrisome
ok we should definitely test that out when we have them in, kat it's great that you have a moto x :simple_smile:
mine is first gen though, it sounds like theirs might be second gen
better than nothing, but not quite the same. the pixel density on mine is much lower.
ok gotcha

<@U02F8TTPU>: while you're in the results cards, it looks like they aren't being displayed in the correct order but i'm wondering if that has to do with the info active theory is sending us. how are those being displayed?
Cards are being displayed in the order received... if we want a specific sorting order, we can do that, but it needs to apply to all results equally

It looks like they should have a different order based on experience, for example block party and paper planes have the map at the top whereas the others have a text card at the top. Is it possible active theory could send them in a different order?
yes, if active theory sends them in a different order, they should be displayed in that order
ok cool
pushing some more lint things unless there are any objections
<@U02F8TTPU>: are the images in the gallery also pulled in from the .zip file we get from active theory?
No, the images in the gallery are loaded directly from the URLs given in the JSON from AT
Volley caches them for us, but they have to load from the web for the first time
Ah ok, but AT is still controlling those images
Yes indeed
awesome thank you
also looks like QA reopened this issue - <https://droga5.atlassian.net/browse/DTHDR-85>
<@U02F8TTPU>: do you think that could be related to the splash animation as well?
Yes, I believe that's the crash I saw earlier... it's crashing in android.view.GLES20Canvas.drawBitmap for drawing a bitmap that had already been recycled
So we need another fix for the animation that works on Motos, I suspect they're doing the early 4.1 strategy of selectively disabling some graphics features to save CPU when load is high
gotcha
Maybe newer animation assets with scaling will make it possible to display that animation
are the scaled frames in place?
if not, lets ignore this until they are.
<@U0261PCRQ> I believe got the assets not too long ago
I did
putting them in now
cool.

if this remains, ill hop on it.

even tho its been finished

its actually kind of weird.

no errors or anything
